channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why VA mental health workers feel Elon Musk's emails are psychological warfare
item.description: Mental health professionals with the Veterans Health Administration say the stress caused by Elon Musk's "What did you do last week?" emails is hurtin...

item.title: Trump wants to dismantle the Education Department. Here’s what it does
item.description: President Donald Trump has said he wants his new education chief, Linda McMahon, to “put herself out of a job” and close the Education Department.

item.title: Paris Gare du Nord trains halted after WW2 bomb found
item.description: The unexploded bomb was found on tracks near the station, with all Paris trains, plus Eurostar to Brussels, cancelled.

item.title: Ex-Olympian wanted by FBI on drug ring charges
item.description: Former Canadian snowboarder Ryan Wedding has been placed on the FBI's 10 most wanted fugitives list.

item.title: Trump says nobody has heard of Lesotho. Can you answer our quiz question about it?
item.description: It was another action-packed week, with the Academy Awards, Mardi Gras and the president's address to Congress. Did you pay attention?

item.title: When is daylight saving time in 2025? Here's when clocks "spring forward."
item.description: Daylight saving time​ in 2025, when clocks change by an hour, is starting this weekend. Here's a look at when exactly we "spring forward."

item.title: How the FDA lets chemicals pour into America's food supply
item.description: The FDA has relied on food companies for decades to determine whether their ingredients are safe.

item.title: Jobs lost in every state and lifesaving cures not discovered: Possible impacts of research cuts
Dozens killed in clashes between Syrian forces and Assad loyalists
item.description: It is the worst violence in Syria since rebels toppled Bashar al-Assad in December.

item.title: Fears of destruction as 'erratic' cyclone nears Australia
item.description: Four million people across Queensland and northern New South Wales are in the firing line.

item.title: Stripes and shades: Africa's top shots
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the African continent and beyond.
